title: Police face scrutiny amid wave of misconduct, sexual abuse and bribery allegations
byline: In the wake of a series of serious violations involving police officers, including sexual abuse, discreditable conduct, and corrupt practices, the Acting Inspector General of Police (IGP) has ordered strict disciplinary action against any officers found guilty.

title: Wimalasurendra reservoir sluice gates opened following heavy rainfall
byline: The sluice gates of the Wimalasurendra Reservoir were opened this morning (19) after heavy rainfall in its catchment areas caused the reservoir to overflow, the Nuwara Eliya Disaster Management Centre announced.

title: Rapid acceleration in EVs linked to rise in accidents: Experts warn
byline: Motor experts have raised concerns that the increasing number of road accidents involving electric vehicles (EVs) may be linked to their rapid acceleration capability.

title: Nepal bans Telegram
byline: Nepal has banned the messaging app Telegram, citing a rise in online fraud and money laundering, the country’s telecom regulator said on Friday.

title: Man who jumped from edge of space dies paragliding
byline: Felix Baumgartner, who once broke the world record for the highest skydive by jumping from the edge of space, has died in a motorised paragliding accident in Italy.

title: Sri Lanka revises maximum financing limits for vehicles
byline: The Central Bank issued fresh guidelines to the banks, finance companies and leasing establishments, outlining the new upper limits for loans and lease facilities granted to purchase vehicles, while removing the preferential high limit assigned for electric vehicles (EVs), effective from July 18.

title: Heavy rain and strong winds expected in several areas today: Met Department
byline: The Forecasting Division of the National Meteorological Centre has issued a weather advisory warning of heavy rain and strong winds across several parts of the country today (19).

title: Sri Lanka set to pay Rs.300-500 million to Adani
byline: Sri Lanka is set to pay Rs.300-500 million to India’s Adani Company for initial costs sustained by it in terms of the two renewable energy projects, a top source said.

title: Opposition threaten legal action over unfair appointment of Special Commissioners to Local Bodies
byline: The government’s plan to vest certain dysfunctional local bodies under special commissioners has sparked controversy, with opposition parties threatening legal action if such measures are implemented unfairly.

title: Businessman, Excise officer arrested in pre-dawn nightclub showdown with revolver shooting
byline: A businessman and an Excise officer involved in a pre-dawn showdown outside a nightclub in Thalawathugoda while firing rounds from a revolver were arrested today by the Thalangama Police.

title: Hatton railway station in darkness amid fuel shortage
Trump says he thinks 5 jets were shot down in India-Pakistan hostilities
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday up to five jets were shot down during recent India-Pakistan hostilities that began after an April Islamist militant attack in India-administered Kashmir, with the situation calming after a ceasefire in May.

title: Bus carrying 20 Sri Lankan workers catches fire in Israel
byline: A bus transporting 20 Sri Lankan youth employed in Israel’s agricultural sector caught fire yesterday morning near Kiryat Malakhi,  Sri Lankan Embassy in Israel said.

title: Over 1,000 calls received to adopt abandoned baby in Mawathagama
byline: More than 1,000 phone calls have been received from individuals expressing interest in adopting the two-day-old baby girl who was found abandoned under a tree in a paddy field in Paragahadeniya, Mawathagama, police said.
